name: Dallas, Texas
label: City Â· Texas
description: Major metropolitan area in Texas and the site of the JFK assassination on November 22, 1963.

events.title: Assassination of JFK
events.description: President Kennedy shot in Dealey Plaza

events.title: Oswald Transfer
events.description: Lee Harvey Oswald killed by Jack Ruby

name: Dealey Plaza
label: Plaza Â· Dallas
description: City park in downtown Dallas, Texas, where President John F. Kennedy was assassinated on November 22, 1963.

events.title: JFK Assassination
events.description: President Kennedy shot while traveling in motorcade

name: Texas School Book Depository
label: Building Â· Dealey Plaza
description: The workplace of Lee Harvey Oswald and the site from which the Warren Commission concluded he fired the shots that killed President Kennedy.

events.title: Shots fired
events.description: Three shots fired from the sixth floor window

label: Street Â· Downtown Dallas
name: Commerce Street
notes: Street in downtown Dallas. Yates took the Commerce Street exit from the expressway, then turned onto Houston Street. Texas Butchers Supply Company was located at 2038 Commerce Street.

label: Private Residence Â· Dallas, TX
name: 13770 Sprucewood, Dallas TX
notes: Residence of J.O. Smith, uncle of Ralph Leon Yates.

label: Infrastructure Â· Dealey Plaza
name: Triple Underpass
notes: Railway overpass at the west end of Dealey Plaza where Elm, Main, and Commerce Streets converge. As the hitchhiker exited Yates' truck, he said something about the Triple Underpass that Yates could not understand.

label: Federal Office Â· Dallas, TX
name: Dallas FBI Office
notes: FBI field office in Dallas, Texas. Location where Ralph Yates reported his sighting and was interviewed multiple times (Nov 26, Nov 27, Dec 10, Jan 3, Jan 4, Jan 15).

label: City Â· Texas
name: Del Rio, Texas
notes: City in southwest Texas near the Mexican border. Location where Ralph Leon Yates was arrested for tire theft in 1954 and sentenced to thirty days in jail.

label: Neighborhood Â· Dallas, TX
name: Oak Cliff
notes: Section of Dallas located south of downtown. Location of Charlie's Ranch Meat Market (Wynnewood Village) and Oswald's rooming house on Beckley Street.

label: Highway Â· Dallas, TX
name: R.L. Thornton Expressway
notes: Major expressway in Dallas where Ralph Yates picked up the hitchhiker near the Beckley Street entrance, approximately 10:30 AM on November 20 or 21, 1963.

label: Shopping Center Â· Dallas, TX
name: Wynnewood Village (Wynnewood Shopping Center)
notes: Shopping center in Oak Cliff section of Dallas. Location of Charlie's Ranch Meat Market at address 249. Yates claimed he stopped here to pick up a check before encountering the hitchhiker.

label: Street Â· Dallas, TX (Oak Cliff)
name: Beckley Street
notes: Street in Oak Cliff section of Dallas. Entrance to the R.L. Thornton Expressway where Yates reported picking up the hitchhiker. Also notable: Oswald's rooming house was located at 1026 N. Beckley.

label: Street Â· Downtown Dallas
name: Houston Street
notes: Street in downtown Dallas running north-south past Dealey Plaza and the Texas School Book Depository. The hitchhiker indicated he was going to Houston Street.

label: Street Â· Irving, TX
name: Shady Grove Road at Story Road
notes: Location of Park-It Market Drive-In Grocery at 2320 Shady Grove Road, Irving TX. Destination of Yates' verified service call on November 21, 1963.

label: Intersection Â· Dealey Plaza
name: Corner of Elm and Houston Streets
notes: Location where Yates dropped off the hitchhiker when stopped at a red light. Directly adjacent to the Texas School Book Depository building. Yates saw the man cross Elm Street going north on Houston.

label: Private Residence Â· Dallas, TX
name: 13564 Brookgreen, Dallas TX
notes: Residence of Ralph Leon Yates and his family (wife Dorothy and five children) in 1963.
